description.narrative: FSP-C-SAP 4 Conservation and sustainable use of indigenous agricultural genetic diversity in Hubei
seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Project Objective: Strengthen long-term conservation of Hubei’s globally significant agrobiodiversity, through enhanced provincial policy framework and institutional capacity, and the establishment of innovative incentive mechanisms and technical approaches to support in-situ conservation of indigenous agricultural varieties
Indicator Obj-1: Area of landscapes under participatory conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity
(GEF Core Indicator 4.3: Area of landscapes under sustainable land management in production systems) (UNDP IRRF 1.4.1: Natural resources that are managed under a sustainable use, conservation, access and benefit-sharing regime: (g) other) 0 ha GRFA conservation and sustainable use plans for demonstration landscapes developed and implementation initiated. 15,500 ha Data Source & Measurement: Progress reports based on results of monitoring & evaluation of demonstration landscape activities. Approved demonstration landscape GRFA conservation and sustainable use plans. Product certification confirmation. Risks: Local farmers reluctant to proceed with recommended improvements to farming practices. Cofinancing support does not materialized as planned. Project implementation time is insufficient to achieve required changes in behavior and adjustments to enabling frameworks. Assumptions: Active participation by local farmers and other stakeholders. Cofinancing materializes as planned. Project implementation timeframe is sufficient achieve improved in-situ conservation and sustainable use of GRFA in the demonstration landscapes. Indicator Obj-2: Number of direct project beneficiaries, measured based on: (a) Cumulative total of the following: (b) Number of people living in the communities within the demonstration landscapes (50% women) (c) Number of institutional staff members having strengthened capacities with regard to in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity (30% women)
(GEF Core Indicator 11: Number of direct benefic

comment.narrative:
Project Objective: Strengthen long-term conservation of Hubei’s globally significant agrobiodiversity, through enhanced provincial policy framework and institutional capacity, and the establishment of innovative incentive mechanisms and technical approaches to support in-situ conservation of indigenous agricultural varieties Indicator Obj-1: Area of landscapes under participatory conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity (GEF Core Indicator 4.3: Area of landscapes under sustainable land management in production systems) (UNDP IRRF 1.4.1: Natural resources that are managed under a sustainable use, conservation, access and benefit-sharing regime: (g) other) 0 ha GRFA conservation and sustainable use plans for demonstration landscapes developed and implementation initiated. 15,500 ha Data Source & Measurement: Progress reports based on results of monitoring & evaluation of demonstration landscape activities. Approved demonstration landscape GRFA conservation and sustainable use plans. Product certification confirmation. Risks: Local farmers reluctant to proceed with recommended improvements to farming practices. Cofinancing support does not materialized as planned. Project implementation time is insufficient to achieve required changes in behavior and adjustments to enabling frameworks. Assumptions: Active participation by local farmers and other stakeholders. Cofinancing materializes as planned. Project implementation timeframe is sufficient achieve improved in-situ conservation and sustainable use of GRFA in the demonstration landscapes. Indicator Obj-2: Number of direct project beneficiaries, measured based on: (a) Cumulative total of the following: (b) Number of people living in the communities within the demonstration landscapes (50% women) (c) Number of institutional staff members having strengthened capacities with regard to in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity (30% women)
(GEF Core Indicator 11: Number of direct beneficia

Output 1. 1: Intersectoral and cross-sectoral coordination mechanisms are established and being used to facilitate the planning and implementation of approaches for the sustainable use and conservation of GRFA Output 1. 2: Policies, strategies and regulations related to in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity are strengthened and developed Output 1. 3: Eco-compensation appropriation policies are revised to support the in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity and an eco-compensation plan is developed for protection of local agricultural varieties in the Danjiangkou Reservoir area Output 2. 1: Participatory structures and planning and monitoring protocols put in place to improve conservation of traditional GRFA varieties in three demonstration landscapes Output 2.2: Gender-mainstreamed market- and non-market-based incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation are demonstrated at 3 target agricultural landscapes, resulting in enhanced germplasm protection and securing sustained livelihood benefits for farmers and improved conservation of target varieties Output 2.3: Agrobiodiversity supply and value chains of the target GRFA varieties enhanced through strengthened marketing capacities and expanded application of marketing tools, including cultural value branding and product certification Output 3.1 : Institutional capacities strengthened to facilitate and oversee incentive-based in-situ conservation and sustainable use of GRFA, through targeted trainings, learning by doing participation and knowledge transfer Output 3.2: Provincial and target county agricultural institutions have incorporated incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation and sustainable use as part of agency workplans. Output 4.1: Effective monitoring & evaluation supported by a representative steering committee and through cross-collaboration on the C-SAP program. Output 4.2: Knowledge, attitudes and practices among farmers, governmental agencies, enterprises and the public improved through implementation of a targeted knowledge management strategy and action plan

1. Provincial Policy and Regulatory Framework a) Intersectoral and cross-sectoral coordination mechanisms, such as County level GRFA coordination committees, are established and being used to facilitate the planning and implementation of approaches for the sustainable use and conservation of GRFA b) Policies, strategies and regulations related to in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity are strengthened and developed c) Eco-compensation appropriation policies are revised to support the in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity d) An eco-compensation plan is developed for protection of local agricultural varieties in the Danjiangkou Reservoir area 2. Demonstration of sustainable incentive mechanisms for in‐situ conservation and use of agrobiodiversity a) Participatory structures and planning and monitoring protocols put in place to improve conservation of traditional GRFA varieties in three demonstration landscapes (Yunyang, Danjiangkou and Xishui) b) Gender-mainstreamed market- and non-market-based incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation are demonstrated at 3 target agricultural landscapes, resulting in enhanced germplasm protection and securing sustained livelihood benefits for farmers and improved conservation of target varieties c) Agrobiodiversity supply and value chains of the target GRFA varieties enhanced through strengthened marketing capacities and expanded application of marketing tools, including cultural value branding and product certification d) Farmers, agriculture associations and enterprises capacitated and conservation and sustainable use of GRFA improved through partnership development and organizational strengthening, with a focus on increasing participation by women and youth 3. Mainstreaming of approaches and strengthened institutional capacity a) Institutional capacities strengthened to facilitate and oversee incentive-based in-situ conservation and sustainable use of GRFA, through targeted trainings, learning by doing participation and knowledge transfer b) Provincial and target county agricultural institutions have incorporated incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation and sustainable use as part of agency work plans. c) Market- and non-market-based incentive mechanisms replicated in additional landscapes covering other local varieties, generating expertise and support for scaling up 4. Knowledge management and monitoring & evaluation a) Effective monitoring & evaluation supported by a representative steering committee and through cross-collaboration on the C-SAP program. b) Knowledge, attitudes and practices among farmers, governmental agencies, enterprises and the public improved through implementation of a targeted knowledge management strategy and action plan among farmers, governmental agencies, enterprises and the public improved through implementation of a targeted knowledge management strategy and action plan c) A database on local agricultural varieties is strengthened, supporting the monitoring of agroecosystem health, the coverage of agrobiodiversity and the effectiveness of incentive-based mechanisms

Output 1. 1: Intersectoral and cross-sectoral coordination mechanisms are established and being used to facilitate the planning and implementation of approaches for the sustainable use and conservation of GRFA Output 1. 2: Policies, strategies and regulations related to in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity are strengthened and developed Output 1. 3: Eco-compensation appropriation policies are revised to support the in-situ conservation and sustainable use of agrobiodiversity and an eco-compensation plan is developed for protection of local agricultural varieties in the Danjiangkou Reservoir area Output 2. 1: Participatory structures and planning and monitoring protocols put in place to improve conservation of traditional GRFA varieties in three demonstration landscapes Output 2.2: Gender-mainstreamed market- and non-market-based incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation are demonstrated at 3 target agricultural landscapes, resulting in enhanced germplasm protection and securing sustained livelihood benefits for farmers and improved conservation of target varieties Output 2.3: Agrobiodiversity supply and value chains of the target GRFA varieties enhanced through strengthened marketing capacities and expanded application of marketing tools, including cultural value branding and product certification Output 3.1 : Institutional capacities strengthened to facilitate and oversee incentive-based in-situ conservation and sustainable use of GRFA, through targeted trainings, learning by doing participation and knowledge transfer Output 3.2: Provincial and target county agricultural institutions have incorporated incentive mechanisms for in-situ agrobiodiversity conservation and sustainable use as part of agency workplans. Output 4.1: Effective monitoring & evaluation supported by a representative steering committee and through cross-collaboration on the C-SAP program. Output 4.2: Knowledge, attitudes and practices among farmers, governmental agencies, enterprises and the public improved through implementation of a targeted knowledge management strategy and action plan

A provincial GRFA coordination committee was established together with PSC from 4 different department. 3 women among 13 PSC representatives. County level GRFA coordination committees in Yunyang, Danjiangkou and Xishui counties will be established in 2021. (Activities 1. 1. 1) Landscape partnership working groups for the three demonstration landscapes in Yunyang, Danjiangkou and Xishui counties were established and operationalized. CTA, experts and PMO staff visited 3 project sites and strengthened the partnership with the local groups. (Activities 2. 1. 1) The monitoring and evaluation plan in the PPG was reviewed in the inception report, including the results framework baseline and biodiversity tracking tools. 2 output-level indicators were discussed during the PSC meeting and changes for these two indicators were approved by PSC members, which will be revised in 2021 PIR. (Activities 3.3.1) The project inception workshop and the first PSC meeting was held on September 29, 2020. 42 attendees (11 women) from UNDP, Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Hubei Provincial Department of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, other departments, universities, private sectors and PMO joined the meeting. (Activities 4.1.1)
